<h1>Input Data <h1>

<h2>Species<h2>

The required files are:<br>
inside the folder named after the species code there are 4 files:

           FILE NAME                      EXAMPLE                          COLUMNS

_{{{species_code_number}}}_.csv       e.g: 101616.csv	contains three columns: *{{{species_code}}}*, *longitude*, *latitude* <br>
	
_{{species_code_number}}}_-chull.csv       e.g: 101616-chull.csv	contains two columns: *longitude*, *latitude*<br>
	
_{{species_code_number}}}_-chull-buff.csv  e.g: 101616-chull-buff.csv	contains two columns: *longitude*, *latitude*<br>

_{{species_code_number}}}_-info.txt        e.g:  101616-info.txt    <br>

<br>
<h2> Bioclim <h2><br>
<br>
This folder requires each of the variables to have a file named p1.asc , p2.asc, p3.asc, etc.<br>

 <br>
 <h2>Summaries<h2><br>
 
 This folder holds shape file, it doesn't matter the name of the file although all the files must have the same name<br>
 example: <br>
	SurAmerica.dbf<br>
	SurAmerica.prj<br>
	SurAmerica.qix<br>
	SurAmerica.sbn<br>
	SurAmerica.sbx<br>
	SurAmerica.shp<br>
	SurAmerica.shx <br>
